--- ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: class: middle # Feature engineering --- ## Feature engineering - We prefer simple models when possible, but **parsimony** does not mean sacrificing accuracy (or predictive performance) in the interest of simplicity -- - Variables that go into the model and how they are represented are just as critical to success of the model -- - **Feature engineering** allows us to get creative with our predictors in an effort to make them more useful for our model (to increase its predictive performance) --- ## Same training and testing sets as before ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} # Fix random numbers by setting the seed # Enables analysis to be reproducible when random numbers are used set.seed(1116) # Put 80% of the data into the training set email_split <- initial_split(email, prop = 0.80) # Create data frames for the two sets: train_data <- training(email_split) test_data <- testing(email_split) ``` ::: --- ## A simple approach: `mutate()` ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} train_data %>% mutate( date = lubridate::date(time), dow = wday(time), month = month(time) ) %>% select(time, date, dow, month) %>% sample_n(size = 5) # shuffle to show a variety ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 5 × 4 time date dow month 1 2012-03-15 14:51:35 2012-03-15 5 3 2 2012-03-03 09:24:02 2012-03-03 7 3 3 2012-01-18 11:55:23 2012-01-18 4 1 4 2012-02-24 23:08:59 2012-02-24 6 2 5 2012-01-11 08:18:51 2012-01-11 4 1 ``` ::: ::: --- ## Modeling workflow, revisited - Create a **recipe** for feature engineering steps to be applied to the training data -- - Fit the model to the training data after these steps have been applied -- - Using the model estimates from the training data, predict outcomes for the test data -- - Evaluate the performance of the model on the test data --- class: middle # Building recipes --- ## Initiate a recipe ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- recipe( spam ~ ., # formula data = train_data # data to use for cataloguing names and types of variables ) summary(email_rec) ``` ::: .xsmall[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 21 × 4 variable type role source 1 to_multiple nominal predictor original 2 from nominal predictor original 3 cc numeric predictor original 4 sent_email nominal predictor original 5 time date predictor original 6 image numeric predictor original 7 attach numeric predictor original 8 dollar numeric predictor original 9 winner nominal predictor original 10 inherit numeric predictor original 11 viagra numeric predictor original 12 password numeric predictor original 13 num_char numeric predictor original 14 line_breaks numeric predictor original 15 format nominal predictor original 16 re_subj nominal predictor original 17 exclaim_subj numeric predictor original 18 urgent_subj nominal predictor original 19 exclaim_mess numeric predictor original 20 number nominal predictor original 21 spam nominal outcome original ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Remove certain variables ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- email_rec %>% step_rm(from, sent_email) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Recipe Inputs: role #variables outcome 1 predictor 20 Operations: Variables removed from, sent_email ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Feature engineer date ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- email_rec %>% step_date(time, features = c("dow", "month")) %>% step_rm(time) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Recipe Inputs: role #variables outcome 1 predictor 20 Operations: Variables removed from, sent_email Date features from time Variables removed time ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Discretize numeric variables ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- email_rec %>% step_cut(cc, attach, dollar, breaks = c(0, 1)) %>% step_cut(inherit, password, breaks = c(0, 1, 5, 10, 20)) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Recipe Inputs: role #variables outcome 1 predictor 20 Operations: Variables removed from, sent_email Date features from time Variables removed time Cut numeric for cc, attach, dollar Cut numeric for inherit, password ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Create dummy variables ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- email_rec %>% step_dummy(all_nominal(), -all_outcomes()) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Recipe Inputs: role #variables outcome 1 predictor 20 Operations: Variables removed from, sent_email Date features from time Variables removed time Cut numeric for cc, attach, dollar Cut numeric for inherit, password Dummy variables from all_nominal(), -all_outcomes() ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Remove zero variance variables Variables that contain only a single value ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- email_rec %>% step_zv(all_predictors()) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Recipe Inputs: role #variables outcome 1 predictor 20 Operations: Variables removed from, sent_email Date features from time Variables removed time Cut numeric for cc, attach, dollar Cut numeric for inherit, password Dummy variables from all_nominal(), -all_outcomes() Zero variance filter on all_predictors() ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## All in one place ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_rec <- recipe(spam ~ ., data = email) %>% step_rm(from, sent_email) %>% step_date(time, features = c("dow", "month")) %>% step_rm(time) %>% step_cut(cc, attach, dollar, breaks = c(0, 1)) %>% step_cut(inherit, password, breaks = c(0, 1, 5, 10, 20)) %>% step_dummy(all_nominal(), -all_outcomes()) %>% step_zv(all_predictors()) ``` ::: --- class: middle # Building workflows --- ## Define model ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_mod <- logistic_reg() %>% set_engine("glm") email_mod ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification) Computational engine: glm ``` ::: ::: --- ## Define workflow **Workflows** bring together models and recipes so that they can be easily applied to both the training and test data. ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_wflow <- workflow() %>% add_model(email_mod) %>% add_recipe(email_rec) ``` ::: .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` ══ Workflow ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ Preprocessor: Recipe Model: logistic_reg() ── Preprocessor ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── 7 Recipe Steps • step_rm() • step_date() • step_rm() • step_cut() • step_cut() • step_dummy() • step_zv() ── Model ─────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification) Computational engine: glm ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Fit model to training data ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_fit <- email_wflow %>% fit(data = train_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: glm.fit: fitted probabilities numerically 0 or 1 occurred ``` ::: ::: --- .small[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} tidy(email_fit) %>% print(n = 31) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 31 × 5 term estimate std.error statistic p.value 1 (Intercept) -0.892 0.249 -3.58 3.37e- 4 2 image -1.65 0.934 -1.76 7.77e- 2 3 viagra 2.28 182. 0.0125 9.90e- 1 4 num_char 0.0470 0.0244 1.93 5.36e- 2 5 line_breaks -0.00510 0.00138 -3.69 2.28e- 4 6 exclaim_subj -0.204 0.277 -0.736 4.62e- 1 7 exclaim_mess 0.00885 0.00186 4.75 1.99e- 6 8 to_multiple_X1 -2.60 0.354 -7.35 2.06e-13 9 cc_X.1.68. -0.312 0.490 -0.638 5.24e- 1 10 attach_X.1.21. 2.05 0.368 5.58 2.45e- 8 11 dollar_X.1.64. 0.214 0.217 0.988 3.23e- 1 12 winner_yes 2.18 0.428 5.08 3.68e- 7 13 inherit_X.1.5. -9.21 765. -0.0120 9.90e- 1 14 inherit_X.5.10. 2.51 1.44 1.74 8.12e- 2 15 password_X.1.5. -1.71 0.748 -2.28 2.24e- 2 16 password_X.5.10. -12.5 475. -0.0263 9.79e- 1 17 password_X.10.20. -13.7 814. -0.0168 9.87e- 1 18 password_X.20.22. -13.9 1029. -0.0135 9.89e- 1 19 format_X1 -0.916 0.159 -5.77 7.79e- 9 20 re_subj_X1 -2.90 0.437 -6.65 2.95e-11 21 urgent_subj_X1 3.52 1.08 3.25 1.15e- 3 22 number_small -0.895 0.167 -5.35 8.75e- 8 23 number_big -0.199 0.250 -0.797 4.25e- 1 24 time_dow_Mon 0.0441 0.296 0.149 8.82e- 1 25 time_dow_Tue 0.371 0.267 1.39 1.64e- 1 26 time_dow_Wed -0.133 0.272 -0.488 6.26e- 1 27 time_dow_Thu 0.0392 0.277 0.141 8.88e- 1 28 time_dow_Fri 0.0488 0.280 0.174 8.62e- 1 29 time_dow_Sat 0.253 0.298 0.849 3.96e- 1 30 time_month_Feb 0.784 0.180 4.35 1.37e- 5 31 time_month_Mar 0.541 0.181 2.99 2.79e- 3 ``` ::: ::: ] --- ## Make predictions for test data ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_pred <- predict(email_fit, test_data, type = "prob") %>% bind_cols(test_data) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr} ``` Warning: There are new levels in a factor: NA ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} email_pred ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 785 × 23 .pred_0 .pred_1 spam to_multiple from cc sent_email 1 0.995 0.00470 0 1 1 0 1 2 0.999 0.00134 0 0 1 1 1 3 0.967 0.0328 0 0 1 0 0 4 0.999 0.000776 0 0 1 1 0 5 0.994 0.00642 0 0 1 4 0 6 0.860 0.140 0 0 1 0 0 # … with 779 more rows, and 16 more variables: time , # image , attach , dollar , winner , # inherit , viagra , password , num_char , # line_breaks , format , re_subj , # exclaim_subj , urgent_subj , exclaim_mess , # number ``` ::: ::: --- ## Evaluate the performance .pull-left[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_pred %>% roc_curve( truth = spam, .pred_1, event_level = "second" ) %>% autoplot() ``` ::: ] .pull-right[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u4-d08-feature-engineering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-22-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] --- ## Evaluate the performance .pull-left[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ```{.r .cell-code} email_pred %>% roc_auc( truth = spam, .pred_1, event_level = "second" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 1 × 3 .metric .estimator .estimate 1 roc_auc binary 0.857 ``` ::: ::: ] .pull-right[ ::: {.cell layout-align="center"} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](u4-d08-feature-engineering_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-24-1.png){fig-align='center' width=100%} ::: ::: ] --- class: middle # Making decisions --- ##
